customData.content: 44-year-old male presented with right-sided chest pain, dry cough, on-off fever, and hematuria for 2 months. Patient has no history of Antitubercular treatment (ATT) intake and was a tobacco chewer for >20 years. Physical examination revealed decreased air entry on the right side of the lung.

HPI.summary: right-sided chest pain, dry cough, on-off fever, and hematuria for 2 months

customData.content: Contrast-enhanced computed tomography (CECT) thorax revealed a heterogeneous lesion in the mediastinal region abutting the horizontal fissure and cavitation within. Chest imaging showed multiple centrilobular nodules arranged in a linear branching pattern.

imaging.finding: heterogeneous lesion in the mediastinal region abutting the horizontal fissure and cavitation within
multiple centrilobular nodules arranged in a linear branching pattern

customData.content: Bronchoscopy with bronchoscopic-guided biopsy and Bronchoalveolar lavage (BAL) was performed. BAL fluid was negative for malignant cells. Biopsy was suggestive of squamous cell carcinoma.
Patient reported decreased and blurring of vision. Ophthalmology opinion was within normal limits.

HPI.summary: Patient reported decreased and blurring of vision.

customData.content: 18F-FDG PET/CT scan revealed a FDG-avid well-defined soft tissue primary mass measuring 5.6 cm x 7.7 cm x 8.3 cm with spiculated margins in the upper lobe of the right lung with collapse and consolidation of right lung. FDG avid metastases to mediastinal, abdominopelvic lymph nodes and right-sided pleural deposits with multiple sub-centimetric to centimetric-sized bilateral lung nodules were noted. Multiple FDG avid brain lesions involving the bilateral cerebral cortex, cerebellum and pituitary. 18F-FDG-PET/CT showed FDG avid bilateral hypodense renal masses (largest measuring 2.8 cm x 2.6 cm), multiple lytic skeletal lesions with soft tissue component involvement, FDG-avid right-sided lung mass with abdominal lymph node, and FDG-avid soft tissue lesion in the pituitary. Also shows another peripheral enhancing hypodense soft tissue lesion in the left cerebral hemisphere. CT and fused PET/CT axial images showing right parietal-occipital bone lytic lesion with soft tissue component involvement. Metabolically active soft tissue lesions were noted involving bilateral kidneys with extensive metastasis as seen in the FDG PET/CT scan.

imaging.finding: FDG-avid well-defined soft tissue primary mass measuring 5.6 cm x 7.7 cm x 8.3 cm with spiculated margins in the upper lobe of the right lung with collapse and consolidation of right lung
FDG avid metastases to mediastinal, abdominopelvic lymph nodes and right-sided pleural deposits with multiple sub-centimetric to centimetric-sized bilateral lung nodules
Multiple FDG avid brain lesions involving the bilateral cerebral cortex, cerebellum and pituitary
FDG avid bilateral hypodense renal masses (largest measuring 2.8 cm x 2.6 cm)
multiple lytic skeletal lesions with soft tissue component involvement
FDG-avid soft tissue lesion in the pituitary
peripheral enhancing hypodense soft tissue lesion in the left cerebral hemisphere
right parietal-occipital bone lytic lesion with soft tissue component involvement
Metabolically active soft tissue lesions were noted involving bilateral kidneys with extensive metastasis

customData.content: Patient presented with severe headaches and blurring of vision for 15 days.

HPI.summary: Patient presented with severe headaches and blurring of vision for 15 days.
